subject: Law
title: Open Source Software Licenses
description: A micro-lesson that makes Open Source Software Licenses usable.

hook.text: Linux powers most of the internet‚Äîand anyone can use, modify, and share it. Free software isn't lawless; it's licensed.

buildup.text: Open source licenses grant broad permissions to use and modify software while imposing certain conditions.

discovery.text: Permissive licenses (MIT, Apache) allow almost anything. Copyleft licenses (GPL) require sharing modifications.

twist.text: Violating GPL means your own code may need to be open-sourced. Companies have been caught off guard by this.

climax.text: Open source created a multi-trillion-dollar ecosystem. IP law made it possible through carefully designed licenses.

punchline.text: Open source uses copyright law to guarantee freedom, not restrict it.

quiz.question: What does a copyleft license (like GPL) require?
options: Sharing modifications under the same license
